Last month, I prepared a series of lectures for the (really wonderfully organized) first Nepal AI Winter School.

The main talks were,

  • Deep Learning Foundations
  • Humanitarian AI
  • Useful Layers
  • Bayesian Deep Learning
  • GANs
  • Metalearning
  • Interpretability

The lecture videos will be put online soon – I’ll update this post with links when I have them.

I also prepared a short exercise sheet (solutions).

In retrospect, I would have given a more visual introduction to VAEs. As a placeholder until I write about this in depth, here are some notes I kept from a discussion with students from a lab session during the school. I think the most useful pair of pictures was the per-pixel gaussians from the encoder (first page bottom left) and latent-space axis-aligned gaussians (second page top right)
